main event: A cylindrical, cigar-shaped object was observed over Silver Lake, Michigan on September 26, 1960.
interesting points: The object was initially stationary, then accelerated swiftly in a north direction but climbed rapidly upward until it was no longer visible.
The object had a fiery red surface.
Multiple witnesses, including a couple from Traverse City, Michigan, reported seeing a similar cigar-shaped object in the sky a few days earlier on September 25, 1952.
The object was estimated to be visible for 2-5 minutes to one witness and 2-3 minutes to another witness.
The object was observed against a clear sky shortly after sunset, with good visibility.
